column4: i've been having this problem with everything gnome since upgrading to 8.10
and it seems to be something with gconf
like, gnome leaves me with a black screen when i try to login with the gnome session
please ask your question all on one line and concisely
try issuing sudo rm -rf .dbus/ from the command line
remove the .dbus directory from your home folder. Line 6 of your pastebin has an error about being unable to create a file in there
try logging in again and see if it still doesn't work
my theory is that dbus couldn't start because of some weirdness in that folder, so deleting it will fix the weirdness (the folder gets auto recreated), then gconf should work properly
not sure. you could just restart, to be sure :)
damn. same errors in the log file?
do you have that pastebin link?
im going to try reinstalling gconf and see if that helps
lol, I just googled that error message, and the only result was your forum thread >.>
are you still getting that "Unable to create /home/giacomo/.dbus/session-bus" error in your log files?
still getting those gconf errors, though? hmm, looks like my guess was wrong
then that still points to a dbus problem. Throw the new log file, and also the firefox errors, into pastebin
